citation.abstract: The past decade has seen an explosive increase in information about regulation of eukaryotic gene transcription, especially for protein-coding genes. The most striking advances in our knowledge of transcriptional regulation involve the chromatin template, the large complexes recruited by transcriptional activators that regulate chromatin structure and the transcription apparatus, the holoenzyme forms of RNA polymerase II involved in initiation and elongation, and the mechanisms that link mRNA processing with its synthesis. We describe here the major advances in these areas, with particular emphasis on the modular complexes associated with RNA polymerase II that are targeted by activators and other regulators of mRNA biosynthesis.
citation.title: Transcription of eukaryotic protein-coding genes.

wikipedia.title: Transcription factor II D
wikipedia.summary: Transcription factor II D (TFIID) is one of several general transcription factors that make up the RNA polymerase II preinitiation complex.

wikipedia.title: ERCC2
wikipedia.summary: ERCC2, or XPD is a protein involved in transcription-coupled nucleotide excision repair.

wikipedia.title: Transcription factor II B
wikipedia.summary: Transcription factor IIB (TFIIB) is one of several general transcription factors that make up the RNA polymerase II preinitiation complex.

wikipedia.title: Transcription factor
wikipedia.summary: In molecular biology and genetics, a transcription factor (sometimes called a sequence-specific DNA-binding factor) is a protein that binds to specific DNA sequences, thereby controlling the rate of transcription of genetic information from DNA to messenge

wikipedia.title: Transcription preinitiation complex
wikipedia.summary: The preinitiation complex (abbreviated PIC) is a large complex of proteins that is necessary for the transcription of protein-coding genes in eukaryotes (+archaea).

wikipedia.title: General transcription factor
wikipedia.summary: General transcription factors (GTFs), also known as basal transcriptional factors, are a class of protein transcription factors that bind to specific sites (promoter) on DNA to activate transcription of genetic information from DNA to messenger RNA.

wikipedia.title: Transcription factor II E
wikipedia.summary: Transcription factor II E (TFIIE) is one of several general transcription factors that make up the RNA polymerase II preinitiation complex.

wikipedia.title: Transcription factor II F
wikipedia.summary: Transcription factor IIF (TFIIF) is one of several general transcription factors that make up the RNA polymerase II preinitiation complex.

wikipedia.title: Transcription factor II H
wikipedia.summary: Transcription factor II Human (TFIIH) is one of several general transcription factors that make up the RNA polymerase II preinitiation complex.

wikipedia.title: TATA-bindande protein
wikipedia.summary: TATA-bindande protein (TBP) r en transkriptionsfaktor som binder specifikt till en typ av DNA-sekvenser som kallas TATA-box.
